item.title: Contrastive Search might-not-be What You Need
item.author: 152334H
item.description:
TL;DR

  • GPT-NeoX-20B appears to be anisotropic (Isotropy: 0.197)
  • Int8 quantisation appears to have ~no effect on isotropy
  • I am new to ML so the above could be false

2 months ago, I was halfway into publishing a series on my TTS project. Today, the site for that project is defunct, and no new posts have been made about it.

What happened?

item.title: Multiprocessing and random()
item.author: 152334H
item.description:
Let’s say, for some odd reason, you’re hosting a Python service that:

  1. takes requests that run large computations based on a randomly generated number (a “seed”)
  2. spreads work across multiple workers to handle many requests

Then, it’s likely you’ll introduce a subtle randomness bug that leads to duplicate seeds appearing. Let me explain:

item.title: Disco Narrator - Data Formatting
item.author: 152334H
item.description: With the raw data in tow, we can construct a proper TTS Dataset with the use of a few Python scripts.

item.title: Phonecoding
item.author: 152334H
item.description: Back when 2019’s Advent of Code was going on, I started a habit of what I now call phonecoding – the act of programming using a run-of-the-mill Android smartphone.

item.title: Disco Narrator - Data Scraping
item.author: 152334H
item.description:
To train an AI Text-To-Speech (TTS) model, we’ll need to obtain a Labelled Dataset with two things:

  1. Clean audio files, containing only the voice we’re cloning
  2. The dialogue transcript (text) for each audio file

item.title: @cache without @cache

item.description: Memoization is a part of the standard toolkit for, “things I can use to solve the algorithm question in my next job interview”. Most of the time, I like to use functools.cache for this:
